title: Which champion/champions would you guys say is the "Main" character/characters of the storyline?
body: Alternatively, the question can be something like "Which champion do you guys think is the most influential/mentioned the most in lore?"

replies.body:
There's no real main characters in League because Riot doesn't want to make players who aren't attached to the champions in question feel left out.

However, in terms of "protagonist" quality, I'd say the following champions have it:

**DEMACIA** - Garen, Lux, Jarvan IV and Shyvana; maybe Vayne

**NOXUS** - Katarina, Darius, Riven and Swain

**SHURIMA** - Taliyah, Sivir, Nasus and Azir

**ICATHIA/VOID** - Kai'sa, Jax, Kassadin; maybe Malzahar

**PILTOVER** - Vi, Caitlyn and Ezreal

**ZAUN** - Janna, Ekko and Jinx; maybe Warwick

**IONIA** - Shen, Zed, Yasuo; maybe Irelia

**FRELJORD** - Ashe, Sejuani, Olaf, Ornn; maybe Braum

**BILGEWATER** - Miss Fortune, Twisted Fate and Graves; maybe Gangplank

**BANDLE CITY** - Teemo; maybe Tristana

**TARGON** - Leona and Diana; maybe Pantheon and/or Aurelion Sol

**SHADOW ISLES** - Lucian and Yorick

I'm sure a list singling out some champions from others would _never be controversial_, but I'mma stop you right there.

>ZAUN - Janna and Jinx; maybe Warwick

Where's Ekko?  Surprised Janna made the cut but Ekko didn't - he seems more protagonistic (I think I just made that up).

When Camille came out, I knew full well there'd be some showdown (or at least some conflict) between her and Ekko at some point. She's everything he hates, and vice versa. 

While everyone leaves Zaun for "a better life", Ekko wants to make Zaun better for everyone around him, and that's going to involve making (or influencing) change that Camille's... clients... won't appreciate.

None of my favorite champions made it onto that list, either.

I'll add Ekko to it, then. I was of the opinion that Janna is more of an overarching protagonist in Zaun storylines due to her nature as a folk hero and benign wind spirit.

> DEMACIA - Garen, Lux, LeBlanc and Shyvana; maybe Vayne

> NOXUS - Katarina, Darius, Riven and Swain and LeBlanc

I don't think we can call out a "main" character here.
Every champion is an exceptional being and the main character of their own story.

Most influential I would have to call out Swain.
Noxus has business basically everywhere and he leads Noxus.
I'd say The Ruined King. He not only effects his region, but also Bilgewater via the Harrowing.
Even though he's dead?
All the Shadow Isles are dead. Death hasn't made him less important.

Well the rest of the Shadow Isles cast has come back as undead though.

The Ruined King hasn't (to my knowledge).

I just thought that from a narrative perspective, you'd want the main character to still be alive, no?
To that I answer Voldemort. Officially dead at the start of Harry Potter, yet had defined much of the world. Harry is only a main character in that world because of Voldemort.

But aren't there some champions that can be considered main character BECAUSE of The Ruined King?

Just like how Harry is considered main character because of Voldemort?

I'm not intimately familiar with Shadow Isles lore, but my understanding is that none who are left defeated the Ruined King the way Harry had. Harry became a legend in Voldemort's absence, while only more chaos has come from the Ruined King's demise.

I see.

Thank you for sharing your thoughts.

With that argument about not just affecting his own region:
{{champion:50}} 

He leads Noxus, is in war with Ionia and Demacia, has business in Zaun and Piltover as well, since Noxus tries to conquer it.
Affects Bilgewater (GP stealing his ship, so they got a fleet there), Shadow Isles (sending Elise to gather magical artefacts)....
{{champion:136}} created the entire world of runnetera in his story out of a star I think

Overall I think {{champion:13}} is the most main-est character lore-wise. Simply because 
A) He has a very interesting, unfinished mission to travel across the entire world to shut down magical threats and hide World Runes
and B) Due to his very distant travels, he's come to make a hella lot of relationships with many characters. On his Universe page, many characters like Miss Fortune, Galio and Nasus appear on his 'related' section, and when asked about this (if i recall correctly) a Rioter stated that Ryze meets a lot of different people when he travels to a lot of different places.
